definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: We Canadians are close neighbors. Give me that Chrysler at half price"?
sentences.chinese: 我們是你們的鄰居，那輛克萊斯勒半價給我好嗎？

sentences.english: They may unless we get a half-price ticket for you.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，除非我們能買到一張半價票。

sentences.english: You can buy half-price tickets show starts.
sentences.chinese: 演出開始前半小時可以買到半價票。

sentences.english: The admission ticket is HK$50 each, students and elderly are entitled to enjoy 50% discount.
sentences.chinese: 入場券每張港幣五十元正，學生和長者半價優惠。

sentences.english: You can buy half-price tickets half an hour before the show starts.
sentences.chinese: 演出開始前半小時可以買到半價票。

sentences.english: Single drink, enjoy half-price for concession cup.
sentences.chinese: 單杯飲料或酒水，續杯享受半價優惠。

sentences.english: I can let you have this dictionary at half its price.
sentences.chinese: 我可以按半價把這本詞典讓給你。

sentences.english: Finding the sweater you want is on sale for half price.
sentences.chinese: 發現你喜歡的那件毛衣打半價。

sentences.english: Do you know that all of these tickets are half off?
sentences.chinese: 你知道這些票都半價了嗎？

sentences.english: A: We are not going to carry these damaged goods back. Would you accept to buy these goods at half price?
sentences.chinese: 破損貨物就不打算運回去了，能以半價處理給你們嗎？

sentences.english: This is my certificate for a half-price ticket.
sentences.chinese: 這是我買半價票的證明。

sentences.english: My student identity card enables me to travel half-price on trains.
sentences.chinese: 我的學生證使我能夠以半價乘火車旅行。

sentences.english: A student might buy theatre tickets on Groupon for half price.
sentences.chinese: 學生可以通過高朋網購買半價電影票。

sentences.english: Yeah, I make certain. A half-price ticket cuts us one point five Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 好了，我買到了半價票，節省了一塊五。

sentences.english: Old card with the elderly, half-price concession tickets.
sentences.chinese: 老年人憑老年證，門票半價優惠。

sentences.english: A half to Oxford Street, please.
sentences.chinese: 請給一張到牛津街的半價票。

definition: buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
